title: Climb on the Cross
lyrics:
Well tell the televangelist she's out of a job
'Cause I look good on a cross and I can sure sing along
Overrated, under-educated, simple and dry
Who knew a man's fate was such a hard thing to find
But now I'm spending all my money on a badge and a gun

'Cause shooting strangers in the back seems like a lot more fun

I'll just walk around pretending I'm the only one



Never listened to my teacher

Trusted every word my preacher would say

Always thought the crosshair was simply the sun on my face



But if nothing dies tomorrow why remember yesterday

When an hour or more of sleep might do you good

It's the wish I can't remember yeah it's the thing you'll never say

Oh, and I'd do it all again oh if I could



So fight your family and friends and let them know you're the best

Yeah tattoo "radical" right across your chest

No need for love, you were born to impress



Well, everybody always told me if I made a funny face it would stay

So you better get hip, come and take a liking to me looking this way



Yeah, cause it's been years without a memory

Just ears, a nose, a face

Yeah, just to find out fucking up was in your blood



It's the wish I can't remember

It's the thing you'll never say

And you'd do it all again, oh, if you could

Yeah, you'd do it all again, oh, if you could
